page.title: 16LOCAL HOUSING
page.content: There is a wide variety of housing in the area from medieval timber- framed houses to impressive brick and ragstone Georgian farmhouses, terraced Victorian cottages and across the road from the school a post-war council estate, a large number of which are owner-occupied. Housing is very expensive in the area with the older houses scattered along the Pilgrim's Way costing Â£100,000 or more and an average family house in the village well in excess of Â£40,000. There is no new building planned in the area, a recent project for new homes in the village being opposed by the parish council, and a large number of families have lived in the village for many generations. A few families haved moved into the village in recent years helping to boost numbers at the school which had been falling rapidly.
